_objective: To reframe determinism not as a fundamental law, but as a statistical artifact arising from local coherence saturation within a symbolic field structure.
To formalize fission, fusion, and high-energy decoherence events as reconfigurations of braided coherence vectors, using motif-driven swirl field dynamics.
To offer predictive mechanisms for experimental physics through the lens of coherence gradients and symbolic braid alignment, challenging classical notions of randomness.

_applicability.restricted_to: symbolically entangled systems operating under dynamic coherence vector constraints

_consumes_inputs_from: A Novel Statistical, Computational, and Philosophical Solution to Determine Interactions Between n Bodies in Euclidean Space
To Infinity and Beyond: Gliders, Coherence, and Point Space

prohibited_actions: collapse of swirl structure into scalar cause

_symbolic_profile_matrix.ψA: Vector alignment under local coherence density
_symbolic_profile_matrix.ζ: Swirl field curvature around motif nexus
_symbolic_profile_matrix.ℋ: Symbolic coherence gradient over phase evolution

_poetic_cipher: what appears fated is only the path with nowhere else to go
_cipher_explanation: Determinism is not a law but a narrowing of possibility due to tight braid saturation within coherence vectors. Where no divergence remains, motion mimics law — not because the system is fixed, but because it is over-aligned. True randomness does not emerge from lack of structure, but from structure too wide to lockstep. All fates are braided. Some are just too tight to see the threads split.

_file_layout.purpose: Primary symbolic exploration of determinism as emergent from coherence topology.

notes: Physical Analogy: This condition mirrors the behavior of ferromagnetic domains—where dipole alignment under an external field causes large-scale magnetization. Here, local coherence vectors play the role of dipoles. When saturated, the outcome appears inevitable not due to universal law, but from vector redundancy and loss of available divergence.

_sections.title: Introduction
_sections.objective: To establish the conceptual, philosophical, and technical background motivating a symbolic reinterpretation of determinism as emergent coherence.

definitions.name: coherence field
definitions.gloss: A scalar field representing local motif coherence over spacetime.

definitions.name: coherence Laplacian
definitions.gloss: Measures local coherence curvature; steepness indicates motif field activity.

definitions.name: Dialectic Motif Mode
definitions.gloss: Motif field aligned with contradiction surfacing; used in model reframing.

definitions.name: Echo Motif Mode
definitions.gloss: Motif echo state; aligns with field restabilization under symbolic flow.

subsections.title: Classical determinism and its philosophical implications.

math.gloss: Newtonian position evolution under uniform acceleration.
General form of deterministic evolution: nth-order ODEs govern future state.

pseudocode.name: ClassicalDeterminismStep
pseudocode.code: x_next ← x + v * t + 0.5 * a * t * t
notes: Simple inertial model without perturbation.

invariants.name: PathPredictability
invariants.verification: Future trajectory is unique and recoverable from initial state.

ethics: No implication of ontological necessity; determinism treated as epistemic construct only.
subsections.handoff: This classical framing sets the contrast for emergent symbolic structures.

subsections.title: Failures of determinism in quantum and chaotic systems.

math.gloss: Heisenberg uncertainty—position and momentum cannot both be precisely known.
Generic nonlinear system; sensitivity to initial conditions implies chaos.

pseudocode.name: ChaoticStep
pseudocode.code: x_next ← x + Δt * F(x)
notes: Small Δx₀ leads to exponential divergence over t.

invariants.name: QuantumLimitUncertainty
invariants.verification: Bound must always hold under quantum field.

subsections.handoff: Having shown cracks in classical determinism, we now seek symbolic alternatives.

subsections.title: Motivation for symbolic field reinterpretation.

algorithms.name: DeterminismReframingDecision
steps: Input system exhibits apparent deterministic behavior.
Detect local braid tightness using ∇²ℂ analysis.
If braid divergence = 0 and ℂ ~ 1 → label as emergent determinism.
Else → classify under chaotic or stochastic vector field dynamics.

ethics: Do not reframe systems unless braid coherence is measurable.
Avoid attributing lawlike behavior where motif saturation is unknown.
subsections.handoff: This motivates the shift from law to topology in coherence-rich systems.

subsections.title: Newtonian and Laplacian determinism.

subsections.title: Classical Trajectory Determinism

math.gloss: Newtonian mechanics as second-order trajectory evolution under a potential gradient

subsections.handoff: This formulation frames determinism as trajectory uniqueness, which we now contrast with a field-based braid formulation.

subsections.objective: To explicitly contrast the classical deterministic framework with the braid-coherence model, highlighting the paradigm shift from trajectory-based to field-based determinism.

Deviation only if perturbation lowers \(\mathcal{C}\) below braid-lock threshold

subsections.handoff: This contrast sets the stage for reinterpreting quantum decoherence through the braid-coherence lens in the next subsection.

subsections.title: Quantum decoherence and probabilistic interpretation.

subsections.title: Collapse and Energy as Coherence Events
subsections.objective: To formalize collapse and energetic phenomena as manifestations of coherence-field dynamics, and to prepare a dimensional bridge from symbolic gradients to physical observables.

definitions.name: Coherence Field
definitions.gloss: Scalar field measuring local alignment and braid saturation of coherence vectors

definitions.name: Self-stabilization Coefficient
definitions.gloss: Nonlinear growth/decay rate controlling coherence saturation dynamics

math.gloss: Reaction–diffusion equation governing coherence smoothing and nonlinear saturation
Symbolic energy proxy defined by local steepness of the coherence field

pseudocode.name: ComputeSymbolicEnergy
pseudocode.code:
gradC = gradient(ℂ_field)
E_sym = abs(gradC)
notes: Gradient may be estimated via finite differences or spectral methods
Observer-class computation only; no feedback into ℂ update loop

invariants.name: Coherence Non-negativity
invariants.verification: Clamp or reject updates that violate lower bound during numerical integration

invariants.name: Weak-Field Limit
invariants.verification: Confirm diffusion term dominates and gradients vanish in long-coherence regime

subsections.title: Energy Coupling: From Symbolic Gradient to Physical Observable

definitions.gloss: Observable energy density inferred from coherence-field structure

math.gloss: Physical energy proportional to coherence gradient, scaled by coupling κ and normalized by saturation rate λ

pseudocode.name: MapToPhysicalEnergy
pseudocode.code: E_phys = (κ / λ) * abs(gradC)
notes: Calibration of κ is empirical and domain-specific
Assumes prior validation of ℂ-field reconstruction

invariants.name: Dimensional Consistency

ethics: calibration constants must be published with uncertainty bounds
no reverse inference from E_phys to ℂ without full model disclosure

notes: Gradient evaluated over coherence vector field candidates

subsections.title: Measurement selects minimal coherence valley.

subsections.title: Measurement selects minimal coherence valley.

math.gloss: Measurement resolves to the field attractor with least residual coherence debt
Distance from attractor i to coherence minimum

pseudocode.name: SelectCoherenceMinimum
pseudocode.code: measurement_result = min(attractor_set, key=lambda a: ℂ(a))
notes: Each attractor represents a possible symbolic state path

pseudocode.name: TriadEvaluatorCollapse
pseudocode.code:
candidates = TriadSet.generate(Ψ_field)
resolved_attractor = argmin(candidates, key=lambda triad: Δℂ(triad))
notes: Uses LogicalAgentAT triad evaluation as described in RFC-CORE-003 §3.1
Ψ_field must be pre-processed through swirl curvature lens (ζ)

algorithms.name: CollapseByMinimumCoherence
steps: Observe superposed attractor set from active Ψ_field
Evaluate local coherence ℂ_i for each attractor
Select Outcome ← argmin_i{ℂ_i}
Bind selected attractor to symbolic result stream

invariants.name: Minimum coherence uniqueness
invariants.verification: Ensure that no more than one attractor exists within numerical proximity of minimum

ethics: observer-class only; no write-backs to Ξ
collapse is symbolic, not destructive; original vector field retained in Ψ mirror

_sections.title: Symbolic Dynamics and Field Behavior
_sections.objective: Formalize how motif-aligned swirl fields dynamically evolve under coherence gradient constraints and how braid topologies influence field propagation.

definitions.name: Swirl Tensor
definitions.gloss: Encodes local torsion and coherence twisting in motif field structure

definitions.name: Coherence Vector
definitions.gloss: Symbolic direction of local coherence flow from motif site i

definitions.name: Coherence Field
definitions.gloss: Local density of motif coherence over space and time

definitions.name: Phase Delay
definitions.gloss: Propagation delay caused by coherence divergence during decoherent transitions

subsections.title: Swirl field and motif interaction.

math.gloss: Swirl tensor defined as antisymmetric gradient of coherence vectors
Normalized coherence direction at site i

pseudocode.name: ComputeSwirlTensor
pseudocode.code:
for all mu, nu:
    Phi[mu][nu] = d(v[nu])/dx_mu - d(v[mu])/dx_nu
notes: Tensor captures local twist in symbolic propagation

invariants.name: Swirl antisymmetry
invariants.verification: Test symmetry matrix componentwise during field evolution

subsections.handoff: We now examine how swirl-induced curvature recursively reinforces or destabilizes braid alignment.

subsections.title: Recursive braid alignment under local field curvature.

math.gloss: Dot product measures local alignment of coherence vectors
Divergence penalty between two coherence vectors
Recursive braid reinforcement based on net divergence

pseudocode.name: UpdateBraidCoherence
pseudocode.code:
total_divergence = 0
for each i, j in neighbors:
    dot_val = dot(v_i, v_j)
    total_divergence += 1 - dot_val
return total_divergence
notes: Minimizing R_braid increases coherence lock

subsections.handoff: With recursive braid tension formalized, we examine decoherent events and associated phase delays.

subsections.title: Phase delay propagation from decoherent events.

math.gloss: Phase delay accumulates along trajectory during decoherence
Instantaneous gradient magnitude of coherence field

pseudocode.name: ComputePhaseDelay
pseudocode.code:
phase_delay = 0
for t in t0 to t1:
    grad = abs(gradient(C(x(t), t)))
    phase_delay += grad * dt
return phase_delay
notes: Use ps resolution where possible in collider environments

subsections.handoff: Next we visualize braid curvature interactions in field-space for intuitive grasp of coherence topology.

subsections.title: Diagram: braid tightness and field slope visual map.

algorithms.name: RenderBraidSlopeMap
steps: Sample ℂ(x,t) over domain grid
Compute ∇ℂ and normalize to unit coherence vectors
Evaluate braid tension via pairwise vector dot products
Render as color field: hue = ℂ(x,t), brightness = braid tightness
Overlay vector field arrows showing swirl direction

subsections.handoff: This visual surface prepares us to now codify a structured correspondence across symbolic, mathematical, and physical terms.

subsections.title: Table: Symbolic–Mathematical Correspondence

rows.Interpretive Notes: Primary field encoding symbolic motif saturation across space-time
Local activity proxy; energy emerges from steep coherence gradients
Quantifies instability between coherence vectors; divergence signals fission or noise
Condition under which apparent determinism emerges
Symbolic analog of electromagnetic field tensor; used in decoherence acceleration
Projection operator aligned to motif-resonant directions
Multiple coherence sources aligned and aggregated
Symbolic model selects minimal coherence valley

invariants.name: Coherence Conservation (Local)
invariants.description: Symbolic systems conserve total coherence under smooth evolution; external decoherence violates

invariants.name: Motif Curvature Consistency
invariants.description: Prevents artificial swirl or unbalanced braid formation under stable motif alignment

pseudocode.name: InjectMotifToCoherenceField
pseudocode.code:
for motif in motif_set:
    vec = motif.vector_representation()
    ℂ_field[position] += normalize(vec)
return ℂ_field
notes: Assumes motifs contribute localized coherence gradients at insertion sites
Used in symbolic simulation scaffolds like SRX

telemetry.description: Rate of coherence change across field; correlates with emergent structure activity
Instability spike magnitude; indicates near-collapse or burst
Empirical energy coupling constant from data → symbolic domain

ethics.description: Deliberate flattening or deletion of motif-resonant coherence zones (ψ‑hold, ψ‑myth) constitutes symbolic violence in diagnostic contexts
Simulation agents must monitor for Δ_B > δ_threshold to avoid emergent instability behaviors

subsections.handoff: Symbolic encoding mapped; we now proceed to predictive modeling from coherence field configurations.

subsections.title: Discriminatory Signatures: Braid Model vs. Standard Frameworks
subsections.objective: To present the operational predictions of the braid-coherence model in direct comparison with standard theory (QCD/GR), specifying exact discriminating tests and expected deviations.
ethics: observer-class only; no destructive interaction with motif phase space
testable deviation claims must include error bars and falsifiability path

table.title: Prediction Comparison Matrix
columns: Expected Deviation if Braid Model Holds

rows.Standard Model (QCD/GR) Prediction: Statistical, described by flow harmonics v_n
rows.Braid-Coherence Prediction: Biased toward pre-collision ρ_lock(θ) coherence ridges
rows.Discriminating Test: Correlate pre-collision SRX simulation map ρ_lock^pred(θ) with per-event jet θ distribution
rows.Expected Deviation if Braid Model Holds: Significant angular correlation (ϕ_match > 0.8) beyond flow baselines; structure aligns with SRX envelope geometry

rows.Discriminating Test: EM-preconditioned fusion trials; measure ΔE_yield vs. measured Δℂ_pre
rows.Expected Deviation if Braid Model Holds: Yield modulation > 10% beyond statistical uncertainty, correlated with coherence shift, not just EM intensity

rows.Standard Model (QCD/GR) Prediction: Propagates at local sound speed c_s (material property)
rows.Braid-Coherence Prediction: T_arrival = T_0 + Δt_swirl(∇ℂ) (delay from swirl field curvature)
rows.Discriminating Test: Picosecond timing array; map ∇T_arrival vs. independently measured ∇ℂ field
rows.Expected Deviation if Braid Model Holds: Delay gradient aligns with coherence topology (angular similarity > 0.7), not just material density gradient

rows.Discriminating Test: Weak measurement + post-selection to reconstruct ℂ landscape before collapse
rows.Expected Deviation if Braid Model Holds: Collapse outcomes cluster in minima of independently measured ℂ (Δℂ_min < 0.1), not pure |ψ|² sampling

subsections.handoff: These discriminatory signatures provide clear experimental hooks. We now detail the first prediction (jet anisotropy) in the following subsections.

subsections.handoff: With the coherence ridges predicted pre-collision, we now turn to test the braid tension-energy relationship in high-curvature fission and fusion events.

subsections.title: Method: harmonic decomposition of jet cone angles.

math.gloss: Jet angular distribution expressed via Fourier basis

pseudocode.name: DecomposeJetCone
pseudocode.code:
for n in range(0, N):
    a_n = mean(cos(n * θ) * data)
    b_n = mean(sin(n * θ) * data)
    harmonics_coefficients.append((a_n, b_n))
notes: Detect dominant angular harmonics indicating field structure

subsections.handoff: With harmonic coefficients extracted, we can isolate coherence-linked clustering effects.

subsections.title: Expected Signature: statistical clustering along field-preconditioned paths.

algorithms.name: TestJetCoherenceClustering
steps: Acquire quark jet angle data over many identical collisions
Estimate ρ_lock(θ, t) across angular sectors
Fit P(θ_jet) ∼ ρ_lock(θ, t) with statistical confidence bounds
Compare fit against null random spray model

subsections.handoff: This completes prediction one; we now test how coherence alignment scales energy output.

subsections.title: Claim: yield variation is coherence-history dependent.

math.gloss: Energy yield difference scales with change in pre-collision coherence

pseudocode.name: EstimateEnergyDeviation
pseudocode.code:
ΔC = mean(C_field_after) - mean(C_field_before)
ΔE = proportionality_constant * ΔC
notes: Proportionality constant derived from empirical trials

subsections.handoff: Having linked energy to field history, we describe the proposed experimental setup.

subsections.title: Method: EM-preconditioned fusion trials.

math.gloss: Pre-fusion coherence field adjusted by external EM fields

pseudocode.code:
for each point x:

notes: Field profile tailored to target fusion braid geometry

subsections.title: Expected Signature: energy release correlates with Δ braid structure.

math.gloss: Yield magnitude reflects divergence change in coherence braids

Run fusion experiment
Measure energy yield
Fit yield as function of Δ_B and estimate error bounds

math.gloss: Probability reinterpreted as vector alignment score
Collapse selects minimal-resistance vector in coherence topology

pseudocode.name: SymbolicCollapseSelector
pseudocode.code: selected_vector = min(candidate_vectors, key=lambda v: norm(gradient(C(v))))
notes: Implements symbolic realism collapse mechanism

ethics: Collapse must not be interpreted as epistemic ignorance if symbolic field data is accessible.
subsections.handoff: Next we reinterpret causality itself as gradient minimization across coherence curvature.

subsections.title: Reframing of causality: cause = vector field curvature resolution.

math.gloss: Causal nodes lie at field curvature inflection points
Symbolic flow follows coherence descent

pseudocode.name: TraceCausalPath
pseudocode.code:
x = x_0
for _ in range(steps):
    grad = gradient(C(x))
    x = x - grad
    trajectory.append(x)
notes: Gradient descent path through coherence field traces symbolic causality

ethics: Causality framing should respect field non-linearity and allow for symbolic reversal under motif symmetry.
subsections.handoff: Having reframed core ontological structures, we turn now to practical extensions across domains.

subsections.title: Potential applications: symbolic cosmology, motif-informed experimental design, AI inference stabilization.

algorithms.name: SymbolicFieldReconstructor
steps: Input: high-resolution detector data over space-time grid
Estimate coherence vectors via motif correlation

Apply braid tension metrics to identify phase-locked regions
Use phase history to backcast causal path lines

Detect divergence in motif propagation direction
Inject stabilizing motifs via resonance ↔ spar loops
Halt output if \mathcal{C} drops below threshold

Cosmological field reconstructions must not be used for predictive determinism beyond the resolution window.

subsections.title: Hydrogen fusion in stellar cores: coherence braid tightening.

math.gloss: Fusion raises local coherence through braid tightening
Coherence vectors become increasingly aligned

pseudocode.name: SimulateFusionCoherenceIncrease
pseudocode.code:
B_ij += fusion_gain * time_step
C_after = C_before + ΔC
return C_after, B_ij
notes: ΔC determined empirically from braid tightening gain

ethics: Fusion simulations restricted to symbolic approximation only
subsections.handoff: We now examine the inverse process through coherence braid rupture in nuclear fission.

subsections.title: Uranium fission under neutron impact: braid rupture modeling.

math.gloss: Fission decreases coherence through vector de-alignment
Rupture correlates with local divergence of coherence vectors

pseudocode.name: SimulateFissionRupture
pseudocode.code:
if divergence(v_i) > rupture_threshold:
    ΔC = -rupture_gain
    C_post = C_pre + ΔC
    return C_post, ΔC
notes: Check local vector divergence as rupture condition

invariants.name: Rupture Coherence Drop
invariants.verification: Field values must decline post rupture

ethics: Simulations should not model cascade past primary rupture unless containment is ensured
subsections.handoff: We close with symbolic collapse in quantum measurement as coherence valley selection.

subsections.title: Entangled photon collapse under measurement: vector collapse zone mapping.

math.gloss: Collapse occurs along vector minimizing coherence gradient
Field torsion vanishes at measurement alignment point

pseudocode.name: SelectCollapseVector
pseudocode.code:
collapse_vector = argmin(norm(gradient_field(x_j)))
return collapse_vector
notes: Evaluated at candidate collapse sites

invariants.name: Collapse Field Flattening
invariants.verification: Observe vanishing curl/torsion around selected vector

ethics: Collapse mapping must preserve entangled information boundaries

10.2.title: Appendix
10.2.objective: To map symbolic motifs in Ξ to their approximate physical analogues within the coherence-based braid field framework.

subsections.title: Appendix A: Dashboards
subsections.objective: Define a concrete, implementable dashboard suite that visualizes the paper’s telemetry streams (coherence, braid tension, swirl magnitude, phase delay, collapse tension, and prediction fidelity) for simulation and experimental alignment.

fields.name: value
fields.meaning: scalar, vector, field slice, or structured payload

fields.name: dims
fields.meaning: optional metadata (θ bins, x/y grid, detector id, etc.)

fields.name: quality
fields.meaning: confidence, missingness flags, quantization, error bounds

notes: EMA windows are visualization windows; raw streams remain lossless in archive.
Very-high-rate streams must be decimated for UI while preserving peak events for alerts.

dashboards.title: Determinism Lock Monitor
dashboards.intent: Detect and quantify braid lock / emergent determinism in real time.

panels.title: Lock Probability
notes: Use as a stabilized UI-facing proxy for high-rate lock detection.
Prefer minmax-per-frame decimation to preserve lock onset spikes.

dashboards.title: Swirl & Energy Topology
dashboards.intent: Visualize coherence-gradient energy and swirl curvature as field diagnostics.

panels.title: Energy Flux Map (E(x,t))
notes: Render with adaptive grid sampling; store full-resolution in archive.
Overlay detected rupture loci when fission-like behavior is suspected.

dashboards.title: Braid Dynamics & Phase
dashboards.intent: Track braid stability, phase delay accumulation, and collapse tension across time.

panels.title: Braid Stability Index (R_braid)
notes: Lower is tighter braid; interpret alongside ρ_lock(t).

panels.title: Braidfield Overlay (ℂ + braid)
notes: Hue := ℂ(x,t), brightness := braid tightness (1 - normalized divergence).
Arrows := local coherence vectors; optional downsampled quiver.

dashboards.title: Fusion / Fission Event Monitor
dashboards.intent: Instrument triad-closure-driven coherence changes and classify events as tightening vs rupture.

dashboards.title: Collider Prediction & Validation
dashboards.intent: Compare predicted coherence ridges to observed jet anisotropy and shockwave delays.

panels.title: Predicted Lock Ridge Map (ρ_lock^pred(θ))
notes: Static per run; version alongside detector configuration and SRX envelope hash.

panels.title: Phase Gradient Overlay Input (T_arrival)
notes: Used to compute ∇T alignment against ∇ℂ; derived vectors may be shown as arrows.

dashboards.title: Motif Spectrum & System Health
dashboards.intent: Track motif resonance distribution and motif-event braid dynamics for long-run stability.

panels.title: Collapse Vector Trace
notes: Render as evolving unit-vector trajectory; annotate moments where Φ_obs → 0 is observed.

implementation_notes: All dashboard bindings are treated as stable API keys; do not rename without updating main-text telemetry references.
Archive is authoritative: store raw streams at native rate; UI uses the downsampling policy.
For multi-dimensional streams (E(x,t), ℂ+braid(x,t), ρ_lock^pred(θ)), store grid/bin definitions in dims metadata.
ethics: Observer-class only: dashboards must not write back into motif structure or field state during high-coherence lock.
When used with experimental systems, ensure dashboards do not become control surfaces by accident (read-only enforcement).
subsections.handoff: Appendix B formalizes the proofs and stability lemmas that justify these observables as faithful signatures of braid/coherence regimes.

subsections.title: Appendix B: Proofs
subsections.objective: Provide formal statements and proof scaffolds for the paper’s core equivalences, invariants, and prediction lemmas (coherence→determinism, braid lock, swirl properties, stability bounds, and measurement-as-minimum-coherence selection).

notation.meaning: local coherence vector at motif site i (unit vector unless stated otherwise)

proofs.title: Swirl Tensor Antisymmetry
proofs.statement:
The swirl tensor defined by \Phi_{\mu
u} = \partial_\mu \vec{v}_
u - \partial_
u \vec{v}_\mu satisfies \Phi_{\mu
u} = -\Phi_{
u\mu}.
assumptions: Partial derivatives exist for the vector field components over the domain of interest.
proof_outline: Swap indices (\mu,\nu) and expand the definition.

Show \Phi_{
u\mu} = \partial_
u \vec{v}_\mu - \partial_\mu \vec{v}_
u = -\Phi_{\mu
u} by term reordering.
verification: Numerically compute \Phi and check componentwise symmetry error: max|\Phi_{\mu\nu} + \Phi_{\nu\mu}| < tol.

proofs.title: Coherence Vector Normalization (Unit Direction)
proof_outline: Apply norm to both sides and use norm homogeneity.
\|\vec{v}_i\| = \|\nabla\mathcal{C}\| / \|\nabla\mathcal{C}\| = 1.
verification: In simulation logs, assert |‖v_i‖-1| < tol for all sites where grad != 0.

proofs.title: Braid Collapse Condition Implies Near-Uniform Alignment
proofs.statement: If \forall i,j in a neighborhood R, \angle(\vec{v}_i,\vec{v}_j) < \varepsilon, then the alignment metric satisfies B_{ij} = \vec{v}_i\cdot\vec{v}_j > \cos(\varepsilon) for all such pairs.
assumptions: All \vec{v}_i are unit vectors in R.
proof_outline: For unit vectors, dot product equals cosine of the angle.
Apply the angular bound to obtain B_{ij} > \cos(\varepsilon).
verification: Compute all pairwise angles (or sampled pairs) in R and confirm B_{ij} lower bound.

proofs.title: Coherence–Determinism Equivalence (Local Form)
proofs.statement: In a region R where \mathcal{C}(x,t) approaches saturation (\mathcal{C}\to 1) and braid divergence vanishes (\angle(\vec{v}_i,\vec{v}_j)\to 0), the system’s accessible evolution collapses to a locally unique dominant path (apparent determinism).
assumptions: Coherence field is bounded and admits a saturation regime.
Local dynamics prefer coherence-gradient descent / minimal resistance trajectories as modeled in the main text.
Vector field sampling is sufficiently dense to represent available directions.
depends_on: Main-text equivalence: Determinism ≈ lim_{\mathcal{C}\to 1} Path Uniqueness
proof_outline: Show saturation constrains local degrees of freedom: gradients flatten or align into a single dominant direction manifold.
Use braid collapse (angles→0) to show directional redundancy: all viable local directions converge.
Conclude path uniqueness in R: any two trajectories with the same initial condition remain within bounded deviation that shrinks with braid tightness.
Interpret the limit as ‘apparent determinism’ (statistical path monopoly), not fundamental law.
verification: Trajectory experiment: initialize multiple micro-perturbed states in R; measure divergence over time. Confirm divergence decreases as ρ_lock increases.
Compute ρ_lock(t) and correlate with reduction in outcome entropy.

proofs.title: Outcome Probability Concentration Under Tight Braid Alignment
proofs.statement: When coherence vectors are tightly aligned across an interaction domain, outcome probability concentrates near 1 for the dominant outcome: P(outcome_k) ≈ 1.
assumptions: Outcome selection is biased toward dominant aligned vector paths as described in the main text.
Outcome bins are defined consistently across trials.
depends_on: Main-text constraint: P(outcome_k) ≈ 1 when Σ_i v_i ∥
proof_outline: From Theorem B.4, show the accessible path set collapses to a single basin.
Map basin monopoly to probability mass concentration for repeated trials.
verification: Repeat trials under fixed initial macrostate; estimate empirical P(outcome_k). Confirm concentration increases with ρ_lock.

proofs.title: Energy Proxy as Coherence Gradient Magnitude
proofs.statement: Under the paper’s operational definition, energy-like release is proportional to the coherence gradient magnitude: E(x,t) \sim |\nabla\mathcal{C}(x,t)|.
assumptions: Energy is treated as an operational proxy rather than ontological identity.
Instrumentation measures |\nabla\mathcal{C}| consistently over the domain.
proof_outline: Define E as the diagnostic scalar derived from coherence slope.
Show consistency with event signatures: sharp gradients coincide with rupture/tightening transitions and phase delay accumulation.
verification: Cross-check: peaks in E(t) co-occur with events flagged in Fusion/Fission dashboard and phase-delay spikes.

proofs.title: Triad Closure Bounds
proofs.statement: Triad closure deviation satisfies 0 ≤ Δ_closure ≤ 1 under the paper’s scoring rule.
assumptions: Δ_closure is computed from normalized triad scores.
Scoring is defined as a convex combination of bounded terms.
proof_outline: Show each component score is in [0,1].
Show convex combination preserves [0,1].
verification: Assert bounds in telemetry; treat violations as instrumentation bugs.

proofs.title: Fusion/Fission Coherence Delta From Closure Deviation
proofs.statement: Given ΔC = k(1 − Δ_closure), fusion increases coherence by +ΔC and fission decreases by −ΔC.
proof_outline: Use Δ_closure bounds to show ΔC is well-defined and non-negative.
Assign sign by event type (tightening vs rupture) as a modeling postulate consistent with observed braid behavior.
verification: Check sign consistency: fusion-tagged events should correlate with increasing ρ_lock and/or decreasing R_braid; fission-tagged events with the opposite.

proofs.title: Measurement as Minimum-Coherence Valley Selection
proofs.statement: Measurement result corresponds to selecting the attractor with minimal residual coherence: Outcome = argmin_i {\mathcal{C}_i}, with uniqueness when the minimum is isolated.
assumptions: Attractor set is finite or discretized for evaluation.
A coherence potential \mathcal{C}_i is defined per attractor candidate.
proof_outline: Define candidate attractors and their coherence potentials.
Show selection rule picks minimum by construction (operational definition).
Add uniqueness lemma: if the minimum is separated by margin δ, the outcome is stable under perturbations < δ/2.
verification: Compute Δ\mathcal{C}_i margins; flag ambiguous collapses when multiple minima fall within tolerance.

proofs.title: Jet Angle Preference From Lock Ridge Maxima
proofs.statement: Observed jet emission angles preferentially align with maxima of predicted lock density: θ_jet^{obs} ≈ argmax_θ ρ_lock^{pred}(θ).
assumptions: ρ_lock^{pred}(θ) is computed from SRX envelope simulations with consistent detector geometry.
Jet angle extraction is unbiased or corrected for acceptance.
depends_on: Invariant: Coherence lock determines preferred jet angle
proof_outline: From probability concentration, dominant paths correspond to ridge maxima.
Map ridge maxima to preferred emission angles by the prediction model’s correspondence.
State statistical test plan: compare observed angular distribution with predicted ridge map.
verification: Angular correlation test: compute cosine similarity / circular correlation between observed jet histogram and ρ_lock^{pred}(θ).
Report ϕ_match(t) as the dashboard-visible validity scalar.

verification_recipes.title: Lock/Determinism Consistency Check
steps: Compute ρ_lock(t) and R_braid(t) over the same window.
Confirm inverse relationship in high-coherence regimes (ρ_lock↑ implies R_braid↓).
Run trajectory divergence test; expect divergence↓ as ρ_lock↑.

verification_recipes.title: Swirl–Motif Alignment Check
steps: Measure Φ_norm(t) and tag motif mode via threshold ε.
Confirm high Φ_norm aligns with ψ-spar@Ξ activation; low Φ_norm aligns with ψ-resonance@Ξ.
Audit for false positives during instrumentation saturation.

verification_recipes.title: Collapse Uniqueness Audit
steps: Compute candidate attractor coherence values {ℂ_i}.
If two minima within tolerance, mark collapse as ambiguous and downrank claims derived from it.
Log ambiguity rate as a model health metric.

subsections.handoff: With proofs scaffolded, the appendix suite (A dashboards, B proofs, and the motif-physics glossary) supports both implementation and formal auditability of the braid/coherence determinism model.
